SENT.plain: Trisomy 8 is the most common acquired chromosomal abnormality associated with myeloid malignancy
As a constitutional trisomy 8 mosaicism (T8M), it exhibits an extremely variable phenotype
In addition, Behcet disease (BD) has been reported as an unusual complication of myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS)
To our knowledge, 12 case reports of various hematologic malignancies in patients with T8M and 18 case reports of MDS with acquired trisomy 8 complicated by BD have been published to date
We report a case of constitutional T8M with MDS complicated by intestinal BD and antithrombin III deficiency
